title: China launches new seismo-electromagnetic satellite with European partners
summary:
China launched a second collaborative seismo-electromagnetic satellite early Saturday, aimed at detecting electromagnetic precursors to natural disasters such as earthquakes.

title: ESA studying impacts of proposed NASA budget cuts
summary:
The European Space Agency is weighing options for programs affected by proposed major budget cuts at NASA as it also seeks to expand cooperation with other nations.

title: NASA, DoD Practice Abort Scenarios Ahead of Artemis II Moon Mission
summary: NASA and the Department of Defense (DoD) teamed up June 11 and 12 to simulate emergency procedures they would use to rescue the Artemis II crew in the event of a launch emergency. title: AST SpaceMobile reaches deal to bankroll Ligado’s Viasat settlement
summary:
AST SpaceMobile has reached a deal enabling bankrupt satellite operator Ligado Networks to pay the more than $500 million it owes Viasat, in exchange for L-band spectrum to boost its planned direct-to-smartphone services.

title: There’s another leak on the ISS, but NASA is not saying much about it
summary: A crew mission has been delayed until next Wednesday at the earliest.
